00050 $Log: MoreSetup.h,v $
00051 Revision 1.14  2002/11/08 22:43:02  eskimo1
00052 A bunch of key changes. We no longer include <Carbon/Carbon.h> in the Mach-O builds, which means that individual MoreIsBetter modules can decide what frameworks they're dependent on. Also changed MoreIsBetter to use the standard C assert mechanism.
00053

00083 #pragma once
00084 
00085         //
00086         //      We never want to use old names or locations.
00087         //      Since these settings must be consistent all the way through
00088         //      a compilation unit, and since we don't want to silently
00089         //      change them out from under a developer who uses a prefix
00090         //      file (C/C++ panel of Target Settings), we simply complain
00091         //      if they are already set in a way we don't like.
00092         //
00093 
00094 #ifndef OLDROUTINELOCATIONS
00095         #define OLDROUTINELOCATIONS 0
00096 #elif OLDROUTINELOCATIONS
00097         #error OLDROUTINELOCATIONS must be FALSE when compiling MoreIsBetter.
00098 #endif
00099 
00100 #ifndef OLDROUTINENAMES
00101         #define OLDROUTINENAMES 0
00102 #elif OLDROUTINENAMES
00103         #error OLDROUTINENAMES must be FALSE when compiling MoreIsBetter.
00104 #endif
00105 
00106         //
00107         //      The next statement sets up the various TARGET_xxx 
00108         //      variables needed later in this file.
00109         //
00110         
00111 #include <TargetConditionals.h>
00112 
00113         //
00114         //  "TargetConditionals.h" on Mac OS X doesn't define 
00115         //  TARGET_API_MAC_CARBON, which is kinda annoying.  So, 
00116         //  if we're building for Mach-O and it hasn't been set, 
00117         //  set it.  All Mach-O builds are inherently Carbon builds.
00118         //
00119         //  Note that we *have* to set TARGET_API_MAC_CARBON because 
00120         //  MoreIsBetter code tests it.  However, we also want to set 
00121         //  the other values because otherwise GCC won't use its 
00122         //  precompiled header.  I thought about fixing this by 
00123         //  including <ConditionalMacros.h> via <CoreServices/CoreServices.h>, 
00124         //  but the whole goal of using <TargetConditionals.h> was to 
00125         //  allow MoreIsBetter projects to have no dependencies on 
00126         //  frameworks beyond System.framework.
00127         //
00128 
00129 #if TARGET_RT_MAC_MACHO
00130         #define TARGET_API_MAC_OS8 0
00131         #define TARGET_API_MAC_CARBON 1
00132         #define TARGET_API_MAC_OSX 1
00133 #endif
00134 
00135         //
00136         //      We need a master conditional to determine whether to use 
00137         //      framework notation to reference include files.  There is 
00138         //  no good way to determine whether the source tree 
00139         //  is using framework includes or not, so we make a guess and 
00140         //  say that Mach-O implies framework includes.  However, 
00141         //  if you're building CFM with framework includes (which is 
00142         //  possible, although somewhat tricky), you'll have to 
00143         //  override this.
00144         //
00145 
00146 #if !defined(MORE_FRAMEWORK_INCLUDES)
00147         #if TARGET_RT_MAC_MACHO
00148                 #define MORE_FRAMEWORK_INCLUDES 1
00149         #else
00150                 #define MORE_FRAMEWORK_INCLUDES 0
00151         #endif
00152 #endif
00153 
00154         //
00155         //      The following works around a problem in <CoreFoundation/CFBase.h>
00156         //      in Mac OS X.  CF is assuming that the CW Mach-O compiler 
00157         //      would not use framework includes, which is not the case for the 
00158         //      CWPro7 and later compilers.  We only do this for the CW build 
00159     //  because otherwise the presence of the define prevents Project Builder 
00160     //  from using Carbon's precompiled header.
00161         //
00162         
00163 #if MORE_FRAMEWORK_INCLUDES
00164         #if defined(__MWERKS__)
00165                 #if !defined(__CF_USE_FRAMEWORK_INCLUDES__)
00166                     #define __CF_USE_FRAMEWORK_INCLUDES__ 1
00167                 #endif
00168         #endif
00169 #endif
00170 
00171         // 
00172         //      Previouly we would bring in <MacErrors.h> at this point.
00173         //      However, that's somewhat counter to the idea behind flat 
00174         //      includes, so I've eliminated it.
00175         //
00176 
00177         //
00178         //      Now that we've included a Mac OS interface file,
00179         //      we know that the Universal Interfaces environment
00180         //      is set up.  MoreIsBetter requires Universal Interfaces
00181         //      3.4 or higher.  Check for it.  Of course, "TargetConditionals.h" 
00182         //  on Mac OS X doesn't set UNIVERSAL_INTERFACES_VERSION, so 
00183         //  we only check this if we're not using framework includes.
00184         //
00185 
00186 #if !MORE_FRAMEWORK_INCLUDES
00187         #if !defined(UNIVERSAL_INTERFACES_VERSION) || UNIVERSAL_INTERFACES_VERSION < 0x0341
00188                 #error MoreIsBetter requires Universal Interfaces 3.4.1 or higher.
00189         #endif
00190 #endif
00191 
00192         //
00193         //  We now use standard C assertions throughout MoreIsBetter.
00194         //  Previously we would declare two custom assertion macros, 
00195         //  MoreAssert and MoreAssertQ.
00196         //
00197         //      Our assertion macros compile down to nothing if
00198         //      MORE_DEBUG is not true. MoreAssert produces a
00199         //      value indicating whether the assertion succeeded
00200         //      or failed. MoreAssertQ is Quinn's flavor of
00201         //      MoreAssert which does not produce a value.
00202         //
00203 
00204 #include <assert.h>
00205 
00206         //
00207         //  Chances are that if you're building CFM then you'd much 
00208         //  rather have assert triggered DebugStr that abort.  The 
00209         //  following redefines assert that way.  We don't do this 
00210         //  for Mach-O because you might be building a Mach-O tool that 
00211         //  doesn't have access to DebugStr.
00212         // 
00213         
00214 #if TARGET_RT_MAC_CFM && !defined(NDEBUG)
00215         #undef assert
00216         #define assert(x) ((x) ? ((void) 0) : DebugStr("\pMoreIsBetter assertion failure: " #x))
00217 #endif
00218 
00219         // 
00220         //  Finally, we define MoreAssertPCG, to accomodate some 
00221         //  older MoreIsBetter code that tests the result of its 
00222         //  assertions.  This doesn't fit in with the standard C 
00223         //  assert model, so I've deprecated the approach.  However
00224         //  there's a bunch of existing code that works that way 
00225         //  and reworking it would be likely to generate errors. 
00226         //  Fortunately, all of the old code that uses this is 
00227         //  Carbon based, so I don't have to worry about not having 
00228         //  access to DebugStr.
00229         // 
00230         
00231 #if MORE_DEBUG
00232         #define MoreAssertPCG(x) \
00233                 ((x) ? true : (DebugStr ("\pMoreIsBetter assertion failure: " #x), false))
00234 #else
00235         #define MoreAssertPCG(x) (true)
00236 #endif
00237
